### Chart A

```{r}
library(plotly)
library(rjson)

data <- fromJSON(file="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/geojson-counties-fips.json")
data$features[[1]]
df = read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/fips-unemp-16.csv", header = T, colClasses = c("fips"="character"))
#library(plotly)
library(rjson)

url <- 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/geojson-counties-fips.json'
counties <- rjson::fromJSON(file=url)
url2<- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/fips-unemp-16.csv"
df <- read.csv(url2, colClasses=c(fips="character"))
g <- list(
  scope = 'usa',
  projection = list(type = 'albers usa'),
  showlakes = TRUE,
  lakecolor = toRGB('white')
)
fig <- plot_ly()
fig <- fig %>% add_trace(
    type="choropleth",
    geojson=counties,
    locations=df$fips,
    z=df$unemp,
    colorscale="Viridis",
    zmin=0,
    zmax=12,
    marker=list(line=list(
      width=0)
    )
  )
fig <- fig %>% colorbar(title = "Unemployment Rate (%)")
fig <- fig %>% layout(
    title = "2016 US Unemployment by County"
)

fig <- fig %>% layout(
    geo = g
  )



```
